intro: Sarcocephalus hirsutus, commonly known as the hairy-headed bush, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its dense, hairy leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It produces red, fleshy berries that are edible for some animals but toxic to humans. Sarcocephalus hirsutus is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
